meanings.definition: Smooth, bare rock surface typically found in arid regions.
meanings.sent1: The hikers carefully climbed the slickrock slope.
meanings.sent2: The slickrock terrain made it difficult to walk without slipping.
meanings.sent3: The picnic on the slickrock turned into a sliding adventure.
meanings.sent4: Her smile was as smooth as slickrock under the sun.
meanings.sent5: The artist painted the sunset reflecting on the slickrock.

meanings.definition: A type of sandstone characterized by its smooth, slippery surface.
meanings.sent1: The climbers marveled at the unique texture of the slickrock.
meanings.sent2: The guide explained the formation process of slickrock.
meanings.sent3: The children enjoyed sliding down the slickrock hill.
meanings.sent4: The slickrock resembled a giant, polished stone in the desert.
meanings.sent5: The ancient drawings on the slickrock told stories of the past.

meanings.definition: To navigate or traverse a slickrock surface.
meanings.sent1: They decided to slickrock their way through the canyon.
meanings.sent2: The experienced climbers knew how to slickrock efficiently.
meanings.sent3: The cat tried to slickrock across the kitchen floor.
meanings.sent4: She slickrocked her way to the top of the hill with ease.
meanings.sent5: The adventurers planned to slickrock their way to the hidden cave.
